CWW D.C.

Mastering the Developer Career Journey

Thought leadership, career track strategy and technology trends for software engineers.

Friday, April 28th, 2016 | 8:30am – 3:00pm
Seattle, WA

The Code Writers Workshop is for developers in pursuit of a great life in software. We go beyond code to the hard bits of building a strong personal brand and rewarding career journey.

 

During this one day, hands-on event, you’ll learn practical and technical skills to boost your career as a developer, methods to hone your tech-specific leadership and teambuilding abilities, plus insight on current industry trends. You’ll also have the chance to meet speakers from leading Seattle companies and network with some of our community’s most innovative engineers and thought leaders.

Join us for a day of insights, inspiration and actionable ideas.

Speakers

We’re seeking speakers that are passionate and knowledgeable about a topic of interest to Seattle’s software engineering community. Whether it’s a hands-on workshop, a ted-style lightning talk, a seminar, or an idea for a panel, we’d love to hear your idea.

Subject ideas based on community requests:

  • Upcoming trends in software engineering
  • How to stay current as a coder
  • Managing a successful career track
  • Disruptive forces that might impact software development
  • Hacking the interview
  • Constructing strong culture
  • The art of mentorship and sponsorship
  • How to become an industry thought leader
  • Improving inclusion &amp; becoming an ally
  • Time management techniques for developers
  • Crafting a coder’s resume &amp; online presence

Call For Proposals Will Close on March 5

Talks are accepted on a rolling basis, so get your idea in early for the best shot at being selected. Speakers will receive two complimentary tickets to the event, valued at up to $295 each.

Modev is committed to creating diverse and inclusive events and encourage people to apply to speak regardless of gender identity or expression, age (students and retired folks welcome!), family or marital status, national origin, physical and mental ability, race, ethnicity, religion, socio-economic status, veteran status, or sexual orientation. We believe the best events are ones where all types of people feel welcome and included, and are represented in both the audience and the speakers. Please join us!

Schedule

9:00 am – 9:30 am – Check In & Light Breakfast

9:30 am – 9:40 am – Opening remarks

9:45 am – 12:30 pm – Hands-on workshops hosted by the Capital One Tech Fellows

12:30 pm – 1:30 pm – Catered Lunch Break & Networking

1:30 pm – 5:00 pm — Afternoon Plenary

1:30 pm – 2:30 pm — Expert Panel

2:40 pm - 3:30 pm — Ted-style Lightning Talks

3:45 pm - 4:30 pm — Keynote Presentation

4:30 pm – 4:45 pm – Closing remarks

* Schedule additions coming soon. Schedule subject to change.
